history.content:
I am a senior double majoring in engineering majors, and given that I have only two required classes left to take and that I completed CS61AB, 70 and 16a, I wanted advice on picking courses for EECS/EIS minor.  

For my spring semester, I am signing up for 16B and EE117 (EM Waves, substitute class for one of my requirements).

- Firstly, I am involved in computational materials research, which I really enjoy and it makes me take C100 (which I will most likely sign up for). - At the same time, I am really interested in fabrication of electronic materials (ee courses) and I think this is what I might work on when I go to grad school.

- I really like control systems and quantum mechanics (I strongly consider C191) but not sure if this will be applicable to what I do in the future.

- Machine learning and deep learning (182, 189) are def things I wanna learn.

On a side note, I usually enjoy classes with a lot of math/modelling involved, and CS70 is most likely one of my favorite classes I have taken at Cal so far. 

Wanted to hear some feedback and advice in general.

Thank you :)
history.subject: General Advice on classes
